stories.text:
Hello, I'd like to showcase a project I've been working for some time now The project is called Typosaur and is an interactive spell-checker that provides spelling, grammar and style suggestions

Typosaur is a great fit for Blogs, Documentation and Marketing sites and also supports Single-Page-Apps

Typosaur is currently in Beta and I'd love to hear your feedback!

The API is also available in preview, shoot an e-mail hello@typosaur.com if you want to get access!

---

My goal is to free the web from embarrassing spelling mistakes and improve writing without the need of dedicated writing teams. If you think you can help us achieve this goal (financially or with your talent), I'd love to hear more from you!

Thanks for your attention!
stories.title: Show HN: Typosaur, the interactive spell-checker for modern web

C++Now 2022: Rust features that I want in C++
Ex-Amazon Cloud Worker Convicted of Capital One Hack

stories.text:
We software developers require with regards to oncall

1. We receive a day off after each and every on-call shift whether we were paged or not.

2. Just as when patients who receive treatments from doctors do not go to the same doctor if there is an emergency a special emergency unit is created to handle these.

3. Whenever the teams are global then oncall shifts would be split according to working hour timeszones.

4. Whenever we get pages we demand time allocation to fix the root cause no matter how much time it takes and we are going to have a product freeze until the pronblem is fixed.

5. We are not going to incorporate in any oncall shift which have less than 8 people in the shift such that we would have space in between shifts.
stories.title: Tell HN: The Software Developer OnCall Manifesto
